column4: Households Served by Municipal Trash Program
column5: Households Served by Municipal Recycling Program
column18: Weeks the drop-off center open to residents
column19: Municipal Buildings Trash and Recycling Service
column34: Private Hauler regulations that require recycling
column38: Does trash disposal tonnage include bulky waste?
column75: Did your municipality host comprehensive household hazardous waste collection events in 2012?
column79: Comments/Additional Information

We now only open the mercury shed when we have a volunteer to staff it.  Our new recyclables contract, effective July 1, 2013, accepts bulky rigid plastic.  We are in the process of setting up a textile collection box with Goodwill.
Scrap Metal / White Goods, Wood, Mattresses, Carpets and Bulky Rigid Plastics are collected by Private Hauler.  The total amount is compiles within the Bulky Waste number reported in this document.

Question 2B & 2C: All area college students (with valid ID) are able to use the Amherst Transfer Station WITHOUT the purchase of a sticker.  Because of seasonal (move-out) craziness we do not track the number of student households that take advantage of this benefit.  As there are over 24,000 students attending college in Amherst, this easily brings the number of households utilizing our transfer station to over 2000.

Question 8: PAYT compost collection program began April 2013.

Question 9: EPS shipping peanuts are collected year-round at Transfer Station for reuse (made available free of charge to individuals, small businesses & UPS Store).  Single-use EPS serveware is banned in Amherst as of 1/1/2014; We assume "household batteries" refers to alkaline batteries, which we do not collect.  We collect auto, all rechargeables and button batteries year-round.

Question 10: Pelham, Shutesbury, & Hadley are annually invited to collaborate in our HHW collection event.

Ashby Recycling Center and Transfer Station is open the 2nd & 4th Saturday of each month from 9:00 am to 1:00 pm. Waste motor oil is collected at the Ashby Fire Department every Sunday from 9:00 am to noon. 
The container tonnage includes 17.81 tons glass

We also service private commercial haulers that provide curbside recycling and trash pickup to local residents as well as non-Athol residents in neighboring communities.  The private haulers account for an additional 1554 tons of trash collected.  A portion of the recycling tonnage reported in question #8 is generated from the private haulers.

Household Hazardous waste days are bi-annual, and will be held during the even years (i.e. 2014).
Bulky waste not collected by municipal program.

Our hauler only collects monitors and TVs as e-waste, so we held an event day at the DPW to collect it. The electronics were picked up for free, but the town cleaned out its store of dead monitors, costing us $250. 
The Hauler collects white goods at no extra charge, but we had an event day at which we collected approximately 3 tons of metal and made $360 profit.
In section 9, Oil based paint is collected once a year at the Hazardous Waste collection event. Latex paint is accepted as part of regular curbside trash collection as long as it is dried out.
We host a hazardous drop off day every two years
The rates for recycling are on a sliding scale and vary month to month.  Some months we receive a rebate, and others we pay a fee per ton.
Our facility is a regional landfill that takes in MSW from haulers that collect from businesses and non-residents and a C&D transfer station.  Local business can also bring in recyclables.

polystyrene is placed in the solid waste containers,
We do not accept yard waste at all
Our rigid plastics, wood, mattresses, and carpet are not separately tracked.
We pay .07 for each monitor. Of the 16 tons of e-waste, a quantity of 6215 monitors were collected.
Of the 72 tons of metal/appliances, 64 tons were scrap metal, we received an average of $50 per ton rebated on hauling fees.
Cart program for trash and recycling (64 gal for each) did not start until October 1, 2013
Wood Mattresses and carpet are included in the Buidling and Demolition Debris tonnage.
Paint and Paint products collected at Recycle Depot April 1'st thru October 31'st six days per week.

The City of Cambridge DPW held 3 comprehensive household hazardous waste collection events in 2013 and will hold 4 in 2014. In 2013, 792 cars came to the HHW events. DPW also operates a Recycling Center that is open to the public 15 hours/week and staffed

Paint is collected but only April until October (not completely year round).
24 Tons of books were also recycled.
mattresses are units not tons
Clarksburg's composting program is the sale of compost bins.  There is no municipal pick-up or drop-off.

For #2 total household calculations, I used the FY2014 LA4 Form.  I used the FY2013 LA4 information for last year's solid waste survey.

For #8 Recycled Tonnage, metal, textiles and electronics tonnages are from two weekend events only.  Rigid plastic ton
The Town of Dartmouth does contract with a private contractor to pick up solid waste in some municipal buildings.  Recycling pick-up is done by the Town.

In addition to Household Hazardous Waste Collection, the Sustainability Advisory Committee in partnership with the DPW and Environmental Department hosted a recycling event to coincide with the October Hazardous Waste event and  invited Shred-It to recycle paper and Refoamit to recycle styrofoam. The Sustainability Committee would like to make this an annual event and include other vendors to capture additional recyclable material. 

For the past 2 years the Town has held a styrofoam collection event the first Saturday after Christmas. This event has been very successful and is open to the general public. 

In the future we would like to hold a recycling event in the Spring and Fall. The one in the Spring would be around Earth Day and the Fall event would coincide with Household Hazardous Waste Day. We will also continue to hold the December holiday styrofoam collection event.
Carpet included in Construction and Demolition (wood) waste tons, some bulky furniture as well

Although the City picks up white goods and electronics curbside (sticker required), currently there is no way to estimate tonnage as it is all combined including bulk burnable wast.

Everett participates in the Essex County HHW Collection Network and can refer residents to any open events.  3 are listed above.

Cart sizes vary from 35 gallon recycle/trash carts for elderly or handicapped residents; 65 set for single family; combinations of 95 gallon for multifamily.

Also, Republic Services hosts the annual Household Hazardous Waste event. We participate to the extent that I attend the event and help with answering questions from the residents etc. 

On the question about dedicated enforcement personnel : we have no one full time employee solely dedicated but it is a component of my job.

1.  Our curbside MSW is collected by Town staff; recycling by the Town's contractor. (Disregard question # 5 info for end date of Solid Waste Contract- wasn't allowed to submit form without answering that question)
2.  We also take books, glass, and eye glasses.
3.  Foam recycling - Only packaging Styrofoam is accepted at the Town's Recycling Center, not curbside.

Population and households from 2010 US Census. Some estimation of how many non-curbside households get Transfer Station stickers- records not kept in that fashion. Our mattress records are kept per unit, not by the ton, so I calculated approximate tonnage
We accept household hazardous waste year round.
We received 2 rebate checks from the MRFfor recycling for paper and containers. Total rebate for paper for the year was $3,084.21 and total rebate for containers for the year was $1,567.18.
Bulky rigid plastics with co-mingled as of 7/1/13.

Yard Waste - Leaves and Grass clippings for the season totaled 7,568 yards (drop-off and curbside). Calculation - 533lbs per yard  City pays $175-$225 per load for disposal of leaves and grass.  Wood Chips totaled 2,400 yards or 600 tons.  The City does n
white good tons are included with ewaste.

Lakeville pays a $3.00 disposal fee per mattress.  A total (19) mattresses were collected and disposed of last year.
Yard waste and brush is collected.  The brush was recently chipped and is typically chipped every other year.  The wood chips are available for residents with permit stickers at no extra cost
Lanesborough has no municipal program for yard waste or Christmas trees.  There was no way to record this so it was recorded as available 0 weeks.
All residents in Lee must use private subscription hauling or private transfer station located in Lenoxdale.
Planning to implement drop-off program for carpet to start sometime in FY15

The Town of Longmeadow collects mattresses at the Recycling Center/Transfer Station.  The mattresses are de-constructed with the metal and wood being recycled.  The remaining parts of the mattresses are added to the bulk items.

Hazardous Products Collection sponsored by CMW District.
Scarp Metal/White Goods, C&D Materials, Swap Shop or Book Re-use by CMW District.
#8 (other recycled materials) scrap metal/white goods and e-waste - CMW District.

Medical Waste/Sharps - Board of Health

Recycling Tonnage - cardboard, steel/tin cans, glass, plastic, newspaper - included in single stream.

Bulky waste is accepted at the CMWRRDD Transfer Station.  They would be responsible for tracking the tonnage collected.

Please note the items left blank above depicted under item No. 8 Recycled/Compost Tonage (other recycled materials) are currently being lumped together in 30-yard dumpsters which WeCare Environmental is responsible for the removal and disposal of same.

Please note:  question Enforced Trash Limits at the curb.- it does not allow you to enter 0.
Residents have the option to lease additional trash or recycling carts and/or purchase overflow bags.
The cost to lease a trash cart is $150.00 per year - $50.00

Our number of households does not break out by apartment, it counts 1 condo or 1 multifamily as 1 household.  We do not have information on units for all of our condos and multi's.  Our trash & recycling accounts are mostly single family, some multi families, and if for a complex each condo has its own account.

Also, the public school department has a program whereby they recycle food waste at a local farm.

Bulky Rigid Plastic - We are charged a $124 processing fee each time they collect which ends up costing us money in the end even with the $15/ton credit.

Scrap Metal/White Goods - We are given $210.00 per ton of scrap metal, but we do not make money on white goods.  Our white goods are collecting together with our e-waste so the tonnage shown on this line is a total of all scrap metal, white goods, and e-waste combined.  The cost of our white goods and e-waste is built into our total contract price so we do not have a per ton price.
Melrose does not track tonnage of items such as mattresses, carpet, wood, and metal but those items are collected.
New Ashford residents may participate in special collections held by NBSWMD in other member towns.  There is no yard waste or Christmas tree drop-off.

20.7 tons of tires were recycled
1.82 tons of cooking oil was recycled

E-waste is paid for by the resident ($12/CRT, all other items included), City only pays for abandoned CRTs;  Auto tires (max of 2/week) are collected with scheduled bulk program year-round; Latex paint that is useable (less than 3 years old, more than half-full) is accepted daily at Paint Reuse Shed May-October, dried out paint is accepted in trash; Scrap metal rebate does not include appliances, only received rebate on 162.19 T; Collect about 1T of EPS each year for recycling

The Town of Norfolk Recycling/Transfer Station accepts Household Hazardous Waste one time per week (Wednesday) from April 1st through September 30th each year.  We are a member of the Charles River Household Hazardous Waste Consotrium.

-  Question #8:  The value in the section "Revenue/Cost per Ton" for "Steel/tin/aluminum/glass/plastic..." is an average of the various revenues/costs for all materials listed.

-  Question #8:  "Other Recycled Materials":  Tonnage for Scrap Metal/White Goods is included in the "Steel/tin/aluminum..." line above (97.64 ton metal).  Mattressed and Carpet are included in the Solid Waste tonnage, Question #5, and are not tracked individually.

Changes were enacted in 2013 by the Selectmen for the Town's Yard Waste Facility to increase to fees and restricte use to primarily Town residents.  These greatly reduced the amount of leaf and yard waste entering the facility.
mattresses and boxsprings collected  - 255

Latex Paint is collected year round. Oil based paint is collected 1x per year.
Prices for HDPE Col- Baled 480.00; HDPE Nat-Baled 670.00; Glass -(35.00)

Question 4: Municipal Program Service - Several city departments use the transfer station, but no buildings per se.  Small businesses are welcome to use the transfer station, but we do not actively recruit and typically sell only a few stickers to area business owners.

Question 9: I am assuming "Household Batteries" are alkaline batteries.  We do not collect alkaline batteries, but we collect all rechargeable batteries and button batteries year-round.

1) There is a private hauler licensed to collect trash and recycling in Northborough with about 800 customers, but their customers can also use Town Bags if they choose to.
2) The Town did hold two HHWD events in years past for free but reduced that number to one event per year when participation dropped by 80% due to the introduction of a $10 per box fee.
3) Single Stream recycling started on July 1, 2011.
4) The trash and recycling tonnage above does not include school amounts because the School Department hired a separate contractor to collect trash and recycling as of July 1, 2011.
5) Although collection of other recyclable items listed in section 9 are not collected as part of the curbside collection program, most are either collected at an annual event or residents can find contact information within the annual recycling calendar mailed to each household in June each year.
Peru has bulky collection in the summer months.  There is no municipal yard waste or Christmas tree program.  Paint collection is in Hinsdale at the NBSWMD shed.

out of the 3627 households in Plainville, 1846 are on the municipal collection program,  It is therefore assumed that 1781 have private collection.  Out of the 1781 that have private collection, it has been confirmed that 814 have recycling service.  Either recycling carts or recycling only dumpsters are located on the multi unit properties.

1-Salem has a trash fee, picks up trash from 200 businesses; recycling from any business on a trash route
2-2013: two weeks of Xmas tree collection; plus 5 weeks of yard waste
  2014: two weeks of Xmas tree collection; plus 6 weeks of yard waste
3-mandatory recycling enforcement through DEP grant, runs out 12/14
4-household batteries refer to re-chargeable batteries
5-HHWD is in Salem the last Saturday in September; Beverly residents are included. Salem residents can go to the Beverly HHWD the fourth Saturday in April. Communities have a signed municipal agreement.

There is no current tracking of items being diverted at the drop-of site which accept yard waste, brush, cardboard/paper, co-mingle containers, open to the public Wednesdays and Saturdays.  The yard/waste tonnage reflects the 4 weeks of curbside collection, which  is weighed and tipped at RESCO.

Recycling is not mandatory, however NO visible or suspected bags(we do open bags with mostly recycling and leave it behind) end up in the trash truck.
Paint collection is in Cheshire at the NBSWMD shed.  There is no yard waste or Christmas tree program.
yard waste is ana estimate

If a household already has a Transfer Station sticker they are allowed one Bulky Waste coupon free of charge. If a household does not have a Transfer Station sticker they are charged $25 for a Bulky Waste coupon.

"enforced mandatory recycling" by hauler refers to the one private subscription hauler who dumps at the Sherborn Transfer Station. The way I figured out scrap metal price per ton (since the commodity prices were all over the place) was I added all the revenue we received and divided by tons we sent out.  
For E-Waste, I did not include refrigerators, A/C's and the like, and I subtracted those charges from the calculations of price per ton for E-Waste, then I calculated that price per ton by adding all the charges for E-waste and divided by tons delivered.

Wood (chips and brush), food and yard waste quantities are very rough guesses.
We do accept latex paint if the paint is dried out - we do not accept oil-based paint (except during a Haz-waste event).
Separate types of paint collected, as latex paint can be prepared for disposal.  Please note Oil Paint collected.
Residents may contact the Board of Health to set up an appointment to go to the hazardous waste disposal facility located in Lexington.
NEDT is in Sutton and gives residents an outlet for HHHW.
residents could purchase a sticker to dump yard waste at a private facility.
Christmas trees are picked up at curbside during the month of January
Lexington sells compost bins from State Contract to Waltham residents.

The Town of Wareham has a contract (EXPIRED BUT IN RENEWAL PROCESS) with a private disposal company for municipal buildlings for trash and recyclables.  It has nothing for residents except the following: 
1) The town has a recycling drop-off center which is currently funded by a grant from the estate of a private party.  In addition to the routine recycling items the center handles paint (both latex and oil-based), tires, lead core and re-chargeable batteries, fluoresent bulbs other mercury bearing items including thermostats, thermometers and smoke detectors.  In addition the center takes old flags, white metal goods, and misc. metal of all types.
Approximately in February 2015,  the private grant will be exhausted and the center will have to shut down and in additional all recycling focus will be lost for the town of Wareham.
2. The town of Wareham participates in the Carver-Marion-Wareham Regional Refuse Disposal District.  This provides residents with two transfer facilities for trash and some recyclables disposal.  These are both located out of the town of Wareham.  A sticker is required for residents to utilize these facilities.
Medical waste and sharps are collected every day at the main fire station
The Town of Wellfleet began a Pay As You Throw program on December 1, 2013.

The company we contract with to run our transfer station (E.L. Harvey & Sons) does not weigh recyclables.  As part of our contract, they do collect them, but they are just combined with materials Harvey's  recycles through their own business.

The tonnages reported for recycled paper, cardboard and all commingled glass, metal and plastic containers does not include all the materials collected by private haulers at the City's multifamilies- trailer parks (6), condos (21), apartment complexes with 6 or > units (61). We were not able to obtain these tonnage reports from the haulers. Some of these are single-stream.

Other totals not listed above are: 12.098 tons of books for re-use, 137 (count) freon appliances, 92 (count) propane tanks recycled, 1667 tires (count) recycled.
Wood, mattresses and carpets are all part of the tonnage reported under 5a.

HHW reciprocal events are also at Abington, Cohasset, Duxbury, Hanover, Hanson, Hingham, Kingston, Norwell, Plymouth, Scituate, Middleborough, Rockland, Scituate, Whitman


Cart program began in mid September 2013 with 64 gal cart for trash and 64 gal for recycling, both collected weekly.  Recycling collection was bi-weekly before the cart program.
Windsor residents bring electronics to collections held by NBSWMD.  There is no yard waste Christmas tree program.  Paint collections are held by NBSWMD in Cheshire and Hinsdale.

Please note that some of the questions didn't pertain to the City of Worcester program, however, since these were required fields there was no opportunity to leave the field blank. For example: The City of Worcester collects trash with DPW workers but contracts out recycling.  The survey question lumps both collection streams together so there is a contract end date for recycling but there is no end date for trash collection.  Also, tonnages were not filled in under other recycled materials.
